main_definition: Whatever refers to anything or everything, without specific regard or limitation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to indicate indifference or lack of interest in a subject or choice.
meanings_and_examples.example: I don't care what we have for dinner; whatever is fine.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Denotes an open acceptance of any option available, regardless of specifics.
meanings_and_examples.example: When I said 'whatever you decide', I meant to show that I trust your judgment completely.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used in informal conversation as a filler or placeholder when the speaker cannot think of something more precise.
meanings_and_examples.example: I'll meet you wherever, whatever time is convenient for you.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Can also imply that one will accept anything offered without conditions, often in response to an offer.
meanings_and_examples.example: She said she would donate her car, but now it seems like she'll give me 'whatever' as long as I take care of it.
